intro: Barrotia pancheri, commonly known as the Pancheri barrotia, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are compound, with finely divided lobes, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Barrotia pancheri is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
